title: Add accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
Redesign ComplianceGrid component with modern patterns
Issue #10: Build Trust Center MVP with compliance display, document access, and security overview

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Setup the foundational project structure and routing system for the Trust Center application.

## Deliverables
- File: src/components/trust-center/Hero.tsx
- File: src/components/trust-center/ComplianceGrid.tsx
- File: src/components/trust-center/SecurityOverview.tsx
- File: src/components/trust-center/DocumentLibrary.tsx
- File: src/components/trust-center/SubprocessorsTable.tsx
- File: src/components/trust-center/FAQ.tsx
- File: src/components/trust-center/ContactForm.tsx
- File: src/pages/TrustCenter.tsx
- File: src/types/trust-center.ts
- Function: App component update

## Steps
1. Create trust-center components directory structure
2. Create TypeScript interfaces for Trust Center data types
3. Create individual component files for each section
4. Create main TrustCenter page component
5. Update App.tsx to include Trust Center routing
6. Add basic placeholder content to each component

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All component files created with proper exports
- [ ] TypeScript types defined for all data structures
- [ ] TrustCenter page renders without errors
- [ ] App component updated to show Trust Center
- [ ] Basic placeholder content visible for each section

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

title: Add SEO optimization and meta tags

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Add SEO optimization and meta tags to improve search engine visibility for "descope security" queries.

## Deliverables
- File: src/index.html (meta tags)
- File: src/pages/TrustCenter.tsx (SEO components)
- Function: Meta tag management
- Function: Structured data implementation
- Function: Open Graph tags

## Steps
1. Add comprehensive meta tags to index.html
2. Implement page title and description
3. Add Open Graph tags for social sharing
4. Create structured data (JSON-LD) for Trust Center
5. Add canonical URL tag
6. Implement meta descriptions for each section
7. Add alt text to all images
8. Ensure semantic HTML structure
9. Add heading hierarchy (H1, H2, H3)
10. Test SEO optimization

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Meta tags properly implemented
- [ ] Open Graph tags work for social sharing
- [ ] Structured data validates
- [ ] Semantic HTML structure maintained
- [ ] Proper heading hierarchy
- [ ] All images have alt text
- [ ] SEO-friendly URLs and content

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

title: Create Hero section with trust stats

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Create an impressive Hero section that builds immediate trust and showcases Descope's security credentials.

## Deliverables
- File: src/components/trust-center/Hero.tsx (complete implementation)
- Function: Trust stats display with animated counters
- Function: Company branding integration
- Function: Call-to-action button for document access

## Steps
1. Design Hero layout with Descope branding
2. Create trust stats component (SOC 2, 99.99% uptime, GDPR)
3. Add animated counters for statistics
4. Implement clear CTA for document access
5. Add trust-inducing visual elements (shields, checkmarks)
6. Ensure responsive design for mobile

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Hero section displays Descope branding prominently
- [ ] Trust stats visible with SOC 2, uptime, GDPR compliance
- [ ] Animated counters engage users
- [ ] Clear CTA button for document access
- [ ] Professional, trust-inducing design
- [ ] Fully responsive on mobile devices

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Build a comprehensive Compliance & Certifications grid that displays all security certifications and their status.

## Deliverables
- File: src/components/trust-center/ComplianceGrid.tsx
- File: src/types/trust-center.ts (Certification interface)
- Function: Certification card component
- Function: Status badge component
- Function: Certificate modal/viewer

## Steps
1. Create Certification TypeScript interface
2. Design certification card with logo, name, status
3. Implement status badges (Active/In Progress/Planned)
4. Add last audit date display
5. Create click handlers for certificate viewing
6. Add responsive grid layout
7. Include certifications: SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, PCI DSS

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Grid displays all 6 certifications
- [ ] Each card shows logo, name, status, audit date
- [ ] Status badges are color-coded and clear
- [ ] Click to view certificate or request access
- [ ] Responsive grid adapts to screen size
- [ ] Professional certification presentation

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Create a comprehensive Security Overview section that highlights Descope's security practices and infrastructure.

## Deliverables
- File: src/components/trust-center/SecurityOverview.tsx
- File: src/types/trust-center.ts (SecurityPractice interface)
- Function: Security category components
- Function: Infrastructure details display
- Function: Access control features display

## Steps
1. Create security practice data structures
2. Design section layout with categories
3. Implement Infrastructure subsection (cloud, regions, encryption)
4. Create Access Control subsection (SSO, MFA, RBAC, audit)
5. Build Data Protection subsection (encryption, backup, retention)
6. Add Incident Response subsection (SLAs, status page)
7. Include Penetration Testing subsection (frequency, attestation)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 5 security categories displayed
- [ ] Infrastructure details clear and comprehensive
- [ ] Access control features prominently listed
- [ ] Data protection practices well-explained
- [ ] Incident response process visible
- [ ] Penetration testing credentials shown
- [ ] Professional, easy-to-scan layout

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Build a Document Library with categorized access to compliance reports, policies, and questionnaires.

## Deliverables
- File: src/components/trust-center/DocumentLibrary.tsx
- File: src/types/trust-center.ts (Document interface)
- Function: Document category components
- Function: Email capture form for gated access
- Function: Download/request access handlers

## Steps
1. Create Document TypeScript interface
2. Design document library layout with categories
3. Implement Compliance Reports category (SOC 2, ISO)
4. Create Security Policies category (InfoSec, privacy)
5. Build Questionnaires category (SIG, CAIQ, VSA)
6. Add Data Processing category (DPA, subprocessors)
7. Implement email capture for sensitive documents
8. Add instant download for public documents
9. Create request access workflow for NDAs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 4 document categories displayed
- [ ] Email capture works for gated documents
- [ ] Public documents download instantly
- [ ] Request access form for NDAs
- [ ] Clear document organization and navigation
- [ ] Professional document presentation

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Create a searchable and filterable Subprocessors table that lists all third-party vendors and their data processing details.

## Deliverables
- File: src/components/trust-center/SubprocessorsTable.tsx
- File: src/types/trust-center.ts (Subprocessor interface)
- Function: Search functionality
- Function: Filter functionality
- Function: Subscribe to updates feature

## Steps
1. Create Subprocessor TypeScript interface
2. Design table layout with proper columns
3. Implement search functionality (vendor name, purpose)
4. Add filter options (data type, location)
5. Create table with columns: vendor, purpose, data processed, location
6. Add subscribe to updates email form
7. Implement responsive table design for mobile
8. Add sorting capabilities

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Table displays all subprocessor information
- [ ] Search works across vendor name and purpose
- [ ] Filters allow narrowing by data type/location
- [ ] Subscribe form captures email for updates
- [ ] Responsive design works on mobile
- [ ] Professional table presentation

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

title: Build FAQ section with expandable answers

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Build an FAQ section with expandable answers to common security questions.

## Deliverables
- File: src/components/trust-center/FAQ.tsx
- File: src/types/trust-center.ts (FAQ interface)
- Function: Expandable FAQ items
- Function: Smooth animations for expand/collapse
- Function: Search/filter functionality

## Steps
1. Create FAQ TypeScript interface
2. Design FAQ layout with question list
3. Implement expandable answer components
4. Add smooth animations for expand/collapse
5. Include common security questions:
   - Where is my data stored?
   - Is data encrypted?
   - What's your uptime SLA?
   - How do you handle security incidents?
6. Add search functionality for questions
7. Ensure mobile-friendly presentation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All common security questions included
- [ ] Answers expand/collapse smoothly
- [ ] Search functionality works
- [ ] Mobile-friendly design
- [ ] Professional FAQ presentation
- [ ] Easy scanning and navigation

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Create a Contact/Request form for specific document requests, security questions, and meeting scheduling.

## Deliverables
- File: src/components/trust-center/ContactForm.tsx
- File: src/types/trust-center.ts (ContactRequest interface)
- Function: Multi-purpose contact form
- Function: Form validation and submission
- Function: Request type selection

## Steps
1. Create ContactRequest TypeScript interface
2. Design contact form layout
3. Implement request type selection:
   - Request specific documents
   - Ask security questions
   - Schedule security review call
4. Add form fields for name, email, company, message
5. Implement form validation
6. Add form submission handling
7. Create success/error message display
8. Ensure responsive design

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Form supports all three request types
- [ ] Form validation works properly
- [ ] Clear field labels and instructions
- [ ] Success/error messages display correctly
- [ ] Professional form design
- [ ] Mobile-friendly layout

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```

title: Implement responsive design and mobile optimization

comments.author: runner
comments.text:
## Objective
Implement comprehensive responsive design and mobile optimization for the entire Trust Center.

## Deliverables
- File: src/index.css (mobile-first updates)
- File: src/components/trust-center/* (responsive updates)
- Function: Mobile navigation
- Function: Responsive grid layouts
- Function: Touch-friendly interactions

## Steps
1. Audit all components for mobile responsiveness
2. Implement mobile-first CSS approach
3. Add responsive breakpoints for tablet/mobile
4. Optimize Hero section for mobile
5. Adapt Compliance grid for smaller screens
6. Make Security Overview mobile-friendly
7. Optimize Document Library for mobile
8. Adapt Subprocessors table for mobile
9. Ensure FAQ works well on touch devices
10. Test Contact form on mobile
11. Add touch-friendly interactions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All components work on mobile devices
- [ ] Responsive breakpoints properly implemented
- [ ] Touch interactions work smoothly
- [ ] Text remains readable on small screens
- [ ] Navigation works on mobile
- [ ] No horizontal scrolling on mobile
- [ ] Professional mobile experience

## Validation
```bash
bun run build
```
